meanings.definition: A matter or topic that is not considered important or relevant.
meanings.sent1: The small scratch on the table was a nonissue for the homeowner.
meanings.sent2: In the meeting, they quickly dismissed the nonissues and focused on the main agenda.
meanings.sent3: The debate over the color of the curtains became a nonissue when they realized they all liked the same one.
meanings.sent4: Compared to the urgent deadline, the printer jam was a mere nonissue.
meanings.sent5: She handled the nonissue with such ease that no one even noticed it.

meanings.definition: Things that are not problems or concerns.
meanings.sent1: The abundance of snacks at the party made hunger a nonissue for everyone.
meanings.sent2: With the new security system in place, break-ins were now nonissues for the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: His collection of tools made any repair job a nonissue for him.
meanings.sent4: The strong foundation of the house made structural stability a nonissue.
meanings.sent5: The team's excellent communication skills made misunderstandings a nonissue during the project.
